result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micah Sir Nicholson

defendant.name: Nicholson, Micah Sir
defendant.address: 10500 West Fond Du Lac Avenue #6, Milwaukee, WI 53224

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Micah Sir Nicholson not in court, in custody in HOC. Attorney Jason Canfield does not appear. Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel made contact with the court and requests an adjournment due to being newly appointed. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Micah Sir Nicholson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Margo Elise Clark appeared by video for Micah Sir Nicholson.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony J Moore appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with TNG (DOB 4/4/90); TN (DOB 11/15/14); TG (DOB 11/15/14)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
